articles.title: Feb. 78
articles.summary: This document outlines the San Jose Astronomical Association's (SJAA) calendar of events for February and March 1978, including general meetings, indoor and outdoor star parties, and board meetings, along with details for a 'fast film astrophotography' talk. It also reports on the Western Astronomical Association's (WAA) Winter board meeting, announcing Jackson Carl as the G. Bruce Blair award recipient, and provides information about the upcoming 1978 WAA Convention in San Luis Obispo, calling for volunteer participation.

articles.title: MAP TO MARK TWAIN HIGH SCHOOL AND THE LOS GATOS RED CROSS BUILDING
articles.summary: This document provides the address for Mark Twain High School, located at 7421 Farley Road West in Los Gatos, California. Although the title refers to a map for both the high school and the Los Gatos Red Cross Building, only the high school's address is detailed in the content.

articles.title: DIRECTIONS FROM SAN JOSE:
articles.summary: This document provides detailed driving directions from San Jose to a specific location, guiding attendees via Highway 17 South to Lark Ave, then through local streets to Farley Road. The destination, possibly the Mark Twain school, is currently under construction with muddy conditions and street repaving, and visitors are encouraged to attend this first meeting to evaluate the site. Contact information for Ed Schell is provided for more details, and signs for S.J.A.A. are expected to be posted.

articles.title: Notes from the Board Meeting at Bob Fingerhut's on January 13th
articles.summary: The SJAA board met to discuss various club matters, including student astronomy awards, appointment of new roles like Calendar Keeper and WAA delegate, and planning upcoming events such as a star party and Astronomy Day. They also addressed moving the General Meeting location, setting club dues for the next year, and the club's representation at other organizations.

articles.title: Editorial
articles.summary: The editor, Perry E. Finselbach, expresses his desire to continue his editorship for another six months, marking his 5th bulletin. He states he enjoys the role for now and hopes the Board will agree to his continuation. The piece also includes a philosophical quote attributed to Linus.

articles.title: Blurbs
articles.summary: This article discusses various club updates, including challenges with scheduling Board Meetings due to star party conflicts on New Moon weekends. It announces an increase in SJAA membership dues to $17, while junior memberships remain $10, and expresses a desire to re-engage inactive members and attract more junior members. Other topics include discussions about club trips to Lick and Chabot Observatories, details on AANC-sponsored star parties at Fremont Peak, and a note about Gerry Rattley's technical bulletin.

articles.title: LOS GATOS RED CROSS INDOOR STAR PARTIES
articles.summary: The 'LOS GATOS RED CROSS INDOOR STAR PARTIES' are informal monthly gatherings held at the Los Gatos Red Cross, providing a relaxed environment for astronomy enthusiasts to socialize, share information, ask questions, and discuss their interests. Attendees appreciate the casual setting for learning and connecting with fellow club members outside of formal meetings, noting the opportunity to exchange experiences and knowledge.

articles.title: Red Spot Predictions
articles.summary: This article provides an update on Jupiter's Great Red Spot predictions, noting that due to weather, current timings are based on early December observations. Pete Araballo reported the Red Spot was quite bright, encouraging others to attempt observations. The author also warns that Jupiter is setting earlier and will soon no longer be visible in the morning sky.

articles.title: For Sale Celestron 5 Telescope
articles.summary: This document features a classified advertisement for a used Celestron 5 telescope complete with accessories. Additionally, it provides a detailed schedule for observing Jupiter's Great Red Spot on the meridian. The bulk of the content consists of extensive tables listing various double stars with their astronomical data, including coordinates, magnitudes, and observational parameters.

articles.title: History
articles.summary: The club's general meeting on January 6th saw a record turnout, where new bylaws were adopted by members. Following this, Ernie Piini gave a talk and slideshow detailing his trip to South America for the October 12th solar eclipse, which was unfortunately obscured by clouds at the observation site in Colombia, though his expedition continued to visit Incan ruins in Peru. Separately, the Henry Coe 'star party' scheduled for January 7th was cancelled.

articles.title: MYTHOLOGY
articles.summary: The article recounts the Greek myth of Cassiopeia, King Cepheus, and their daughter Andromeda, detailing her fated sacrifice to a sea dragon and her subsequent rescue by Perseus, who had earlier defeated Medusa and acquired Pegasus. Additionally, it lists several new members of an organization, providing their contact details, and includes a correction to an existing member's phone number.
